properties.areaDesc: Central Interior; Middle Tanana Valley; Yukon Flats and Surrounding Uplands; Eastern Alaska Range; Denali; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country; Upper Koyukuk Valley; Southeastern Brooks Range; Deltana and Tanana Flats
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 3 at 1:32PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks AK
properties.description:
Cold air over Canada will push southwest into Interior Alaska
through the weekend, and into the middle next week, pushing
temperatures below normal in the Central and Eastern Interior.

Temperatures will fall into the 20s below to 30s below Saturday,
and into the 30s below to 40s below Sunday through Wednesday.
There is some uncertainty with the amount of clouds that move
through the area. Cloud cover will increase temperatures locally
5 to 15 degrees. The coldest temperatures are expected to be south
of the Yukon River.

In addition, northeast winds gusting to 30 mph will cause blowing
and drifting snow over the Dalton and Steese Highway Summits and
wind chills to 45 below. Travelers should be prepared to encounter
snow drifts and dangerously cold wind chills.

Residents can prepare by making sure they have cold weather gear
in vehicles if traveling.

For the latest forecasts go to www.weather.gov/fairbanks.
